text: on behalf of the class of
2011 I'm honored to present professors
Francis fry Steven cman Anita elbery
deac
Malhotra and Paul Marshall with the
class of 2011 faculty awards for their
outstanding contributions during our
time in
HBS shepherding a classroom full of HBS
students is not an easy task and these
instructors have differentiated
themselves among as the most admired
among an already distinguished set of
one of the world's most remarkable
faculties the MBA experience is a
fast-paced learning environment in which
students are focused on developing and
contributing to a variety of interests
in a vote by the class of
2011 five professors were recognized for
their excellence and dedication to
teaching
they have positively affected the
learning of students and we take the
time here today to recognize their
efforts students identify these five
professors as those who have enhanced
The Learning Experience by best
demonstrating the following six
criteria inspiration they transfer
passion for the subject matter to
students knowledge transfer they make
difficult course material accessible to
all students through clear explanations
and demonstrated
relevance
accessibility they make themselves
available to students outside the
classroom personally and
professionally career guidance they help
to identify industry contacts and
evaluate potential career
opportunities quality of life they help
to improve the quality of life on campus
and finally feedback they provide
feedback that contributes to
professional and personal development
at this time I would like to ask Francis
fry chair MBA required curriculum and
professor of technology and operations
management to the class of 2011 section
J to step
forward Professor
fry you are as one student put it a role
model to all another commented
she is wise humble and blunt epitomizing
high standards and deep devotion
professor your approach to teaching
inspires your students to set higher
standards for themselves individually
and collectively your students comment
that while the operations knowledge you
taught them might fade over time the
leadership and values you imparted on
them will endure
forever you instilled the belief that as
Leaders we have an obligation to help
others no matter what industry we choose
your impact is felt long after the end
of the first term of the RC year you are
and I quote an inspiration Professor
Francis fry it is my honor on behalf of
the class of 2011 to present you with
the class of 2011 faculty award
[Applause]
at this time I would like to ask Steven
cman senior lecturer of technology and
operations management to the class of
2011 section c to step
[Applause]
forward senior lecturer
Cal whether you were throwing
cranberries across the room in your
waiting pants or roleplaying with
different hats literally you brought
operations to life as you often said to
your students you wanted them to
understand the importance of getting
quote down from the Ivory Tower and on
to the factory floor you were demanding
you expected your class to be well
prepared and push them to look beyond
the answer to the actual reality of
implementing
changes
furthermore you shared your own
experience from both your personal and
professional lives and you shared
examples of your own failure so that
your students would not make similar
mistakes most importantly however you
car deeply about each student and that
care and consideration showed every day
you spent with your section senior
lecturer Steven calman it is my honor on
behalf of the class of 2011 to present
you with the class of 2011 faculty award
[Applause]
at this time I would like to ask Anita
elbery associate professor of marketing
to the class of 2011 to please step
forward
[Applause]
associate professor
elbery according to your students you
are and I quote the most empathetic and
compassionate person at
HBS you have shown that you care deeply
about the future of your students in
unconventional but memorable ways you
expose your students to the complexities
of Industries and business models that
at first were difficult to understand
and then br broke down problems into
easily digestible Concepts that were and
I quote
mind-blowing you did this all on the
span of 80 minutes and with the energy
and flare of the rock stars you discuss
in class on top of all this you
volunteer your time to Mentor students
despite your extremely demanding
schedule according to one if Steven
Tyler could be a professor then that
Professor would be Anita
elbery associate Professor Anita elvery
it is my honor on behalf of the class of
2011 to present you with the class of
2011 faculty
award at this time I would like to ask
Deepak Malhotra associate professor of
negotiation organization and markets the
class of 2011 to step forward
[Applause]
associate professor
Malhotra you care deeply about your
students treating them as colleagues and
Friends rather than as students in the
traditional sense you engage them inside
and outside of the classroom challenging
them to think big be compassionate and
use the power of their HBS educations to
unlock value for others
you taught your students to think about
disagreements from the other side's
perspectives be happy with what they
have been given and that confidence is
saying I can do it while arrogance is
saying only I can do it more than that
you give great life advice that applied
far beyond the boundaries of of the
negotiations curriculum and you showed
thoughtfulness by checking in with your
180 students and individually asking
about their wellbeing according to your
students the lessons you taught them
were among the most powerful they
learned while at
HBS associate professor Deepak motra it
is my honor on behalf the class of 2011
to present you with the class of 2011
faculty
award thank you so
much one more at this time I'd like to
ask Paul Marshall professor of
management practice of entrepreneurial
management to step
[Applause]
forward professor of management Practice
Marshall you were as one put it a
fireball in class who never failed to
impart practical wisdom and entertain at
the same time students appreciate your
direct non-nonsense approach to teaching
and the high standards you set for them
you pushed them to consider the real
world repercussions of their action
plans and did not let them get away with
standard MBA
jargon one student commented during a
case about family business a fellow
student threw in a Chip Shot suggesting
that the protagonist quote align
incentives to make the more effective
apparently you and I quote turn
purple passionately asking the student
how does your mom make you do
things your response and one to which we
can all relate out of guilt have you
ever tried to align your
family you are funny relatable and
action-oriented and most importantly you
made your students excited to go to
class professor of management practice
Paul Marshall it is my honor on behalf
of the class of 2011 to present you with
the class of 2011 faculty
award thank you very
much today we acknowledge the
extraordinary accomplishments of these
five members of the HBS
faculty this year 218 faculty and
1,087 staff members worked tirelessly to
advance the practice of General
management and prepare students to be
thoughtful and effective leaders each
has impacted the class of 2000 directly
and we thank them for their
efforts please join me in recognizing
the accomplishments of these five
individuals and of the entire HBS
faculty and staff
